tasks.task: Attend and participate in farm activities related to cover crop experiments and transition towards no-till practices.
subtasks: Express gratitude to Sarah for a grant to start the project.
Discuss farm background, including location, family history, and business models (CSA, fermenting, education).
Detail soil fertility and cover crop management strategies, including mulching, organic herbicides, and tools like the no-till planting aid.
Present on handling wet soil conditions using mulch and machinery adaptations.
Share data from cover crop trials, emphasizing the benefits of hay mulch over no-till methods.
Discuss the transition to more minimal tillage practices with tools like sweeps and the Alice Chalmers G tractor.
Describe the CSA model, including member involvement and apprenticeships, for education and sustainable farming.
Explain the fermenting business, retail outlets, and the role of cover crops in improving soil fertility.
Present data showing increased soil organic matter over years of diverse farming practices.
Finalize by noting the challenges and successes in implementing sustainable farming techniques and cover crop management.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Attend and participate in farm activities related to cover crop experiments and transition towards no-till practices.
